segments.text: I notice the water spilling over the sink like a small waterfall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It seems surreal, the adult so engrossed in drying a plate while the world around her falls apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are like little shadows, creeping into mischief behind her back.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy stretches toward that cookie jar, full of greed and innocence at the same time.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel my heart race as I realize how easily he could fall off that wobbly stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It makes me angry that the adult isn’t paying attention; this isn’t just play anymore.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is waiting patiently, her hand reaching up as if it’s a treasure hunt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I am torn between wanting to laugh at their antics and fearing for their safety.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s a strange mix of innocence and danger, all wrapped in the backdrop of an ordinary day.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Every second feels precious, like a ticking clock before something goes wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR
